term.name: postmodernism
term.source: From Latin post: after, and from English modernism.
term.def: A radical form of &relativism; (similar to &polylogism; and opposed to &scientism; and &objectivism;) holding that there are no privileged viewpoints and that objective knowledge is effectively unattainable.
A late 20th-century theory and practice of art that devalued &representationalism; and &formalism; in favor of a kind of &eclecticism; and &experimentalism;.
